thread.title: North Korea's Kim congratulates China's Xi on re-election as president - Reuters

title: North Korea's Kim congratulates China's Xi on re-election as president - Reuters
text: March 18, 2018 / 1:13 AM / Updated 10 hours ago North Korea's Kim congratulates China's Xi on re-election as president Reuters Staff 2 Min Read BEIJING/SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has offered his congratulations to China’s Xi Jinping upon his re-election as president, North Korean state media said on Sunday, in a rare direct message from Pyongyang to Beijing after ties nosedived. Chinese President Xi Jinping walks to take an oath, after he is voted as the president for another term, at the fifth plenary session of the National People's Congress (NPC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China March 17, 2018. REUTERS/Jason Lee Kim has yet to visit China since assuming power in late 2011, with North Korea upset by China’s strong support for U.N. sanctions over Pyongyang’s nuclear and missile tests and China angered by those repeated tests. But China has been strongly supportive of recent efforts by both South Korea and the United States to improve ties with North Korea, which includes a planned meeting between Kim and U.S. President Donald Trump. In the message reported by the North’s official KCNA news agency, Kim said he hopes China will make even greater achievements under Xi’s leadership. “Expressing belief that the bilateral relations would develop in the common interests of the peoples of the two countries, the message wished the Chinese president big success in his responsible work,” KCNA cited Kim’s message to Xi as saying. Chinese state media also reported the message, but did not say if Xi had responded. The two exchanged greetings late last year following the end of a Chinese Communist Party Congress. That was followed by a visit of a senior Chinese envoy to Pyongyang, ostensibly to report on the outcome of the congress, but the envoy did not meet Kim. Reporting by Ben Blanchard and Yuna Park; Editing by Nick Macfie
